website_summaries.verdict: Known for its acoustic sensitivity, this general-purpose stethoscope is extremely popular with medical pros. The best economic deal.
cons: Only includes one pair of ear tips

customer_reviews.title: Weak stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: Could hardly hear anything with this stethoscope, which was very disappointing considering this is a Littman product. I needed this for a deployment, couldn’t return it as I had no time to do so. I can’t recommend this stethoscope.
customer_reviews.author: M. Broschi

customer_reviews.title: Is this really stethoscope or is this a toy?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it was lightweight. I've used littmans more many years. This one is very poor quality - can't hear hardly anything! I went right back to my heavier stethoscope.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: You'll never want to use the cheap ones again
customer_reviews.text: My ears aren't great and that's the main reason I bought these. You really can hear so much better. If you go from these to the standard cheapo version it's like night and day. I can have these in and the patient will be talking to me and I can't hear what the patient is saying- just what's coming from the stethoscope. They are designed well and easy to clean. They are light and not bulky, which you will appreciate towards the end of a 12-hour day. Don't be cheap. Get these. You will thank yourself later.
customer_reviews.author: Adam BTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Was adequate, but broke with normal use!
customer_reviews.text: I like the lightweight design and color options. The acoustics are fine for most instances that I run into in a critical care setting. Chest piece broke however after 9 months of use. Construction Of the chest piece is entirely made of plastic. Still within warranty, but so far only able to leave a message to find out repair or replacement options.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Bayne

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and your patients and get any of the littmann cardiology series.
customer_reviews.text: I can barely hear with this, only when it is dead silent around you might you hear a murmur. Office use is fine for hearing heartbeats. Do not use this on ICU patients. Almost missed a pneumothorax with this because I couldn't hear the difference. Save your money and your patients and get a littmann cardiology.
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tried returning item due to not being able to clearly hear sounds. This is the worst stethoscope I have ever tried using. This item has a no return policy. Be aware of this before buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Wells

customer_reviews.title: FAKE!
customer_reviews.text: FAKE FAKE FAKE Yes it’s a decent FAKE stethoscope. But it IS A KNOCK OFF!! No protective wrap, not proper foam padding, .. serial number...
customer_reviews.author: Fateemah

customer_reviews.title: but I’m glad I got this one
customer_reviews.text: I’m a nursing student and I needed a stethoscope for my clinicals. I was unsure of which stethoscope to purchase, but I’m glad I got this one. I purchased it in a lilac color. It is really lightweight and easy to use. It fits perfectly in my ears without any irritation from the earpiece, which I worried about. It sounds clear and I like how you’re able to adjust the setting. It really worked well during clinicals, glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I am certain this is a FAKE.... DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a genuine Littman, and I am pretty certain it's also made of latex, to which I am allergic. The texture on the stethoscope is all wrong. It's matte finish and smells like rubber. Auscultation with this thing is darn near impossible. It's very hard to hear anything, even basic heart sounds. Very low tone. May be enough for basic BP taking, but I'd say that is about it. If you are a doctor or a nurse, save yourself the trouble and get a real Littmann directly from an authorized dealer and consider the Cardiology model. My 20 year old model has seem some miles, but it still works better than this one!
customer_reviews.author: Crissi (Fraz Zled Momma to Many)

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight stethoscope.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. I just found out from a coworker that the head unit swivels so no sound comes out. The website said "3. Rotate to the correct side. When using a double-sided Littmann stethoscope, you need to open (or index) the side you want to use—bell or diaphragm—by rotating the chestpiece. If the diaphragm is open, the bell will be closed, preventing sound from coming in through the bell, and vice versa." Did not know this. I got a deal so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: MGima

customer_reviews.title: My favorite.
customer_reviews.text: My old favorite. Just replaced the identical scope that was 20 years old. The plastic broke at the tubing connection to the bell when dropped on a hard surface. Other than that there was absolutely no wear and tear. Good sound. Can hear well even though clothing. Only down side I can see is there isn't any possibility of repairing it, then again my first one lasted a full 20+ years of daily work use and no doubt it's been dropped plenty of times. Light weight if you wear your's around your neck as I do. No danger of clunking a patient with a hard metal head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does not function
customer_reviews.text: Caveat Emptor!......bought this for school based on large number of positive reviews.....should've read the negatives because there's a common thread that it just doesn't work---nothing is audible. Am happy for those in the vast majority of satisfied customers, but there is definitely a significant number of consumers experiencing this same problem. Fortunately, Amazon will refund the purchase price, according to the nice lady on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen McKeever

customer_reviews.title: Sound is very clear and loud :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my girlfriend since she is starting medical school. The Littmann's are very expensive so I was happy to find this one since she really wanted one a Littmann Stethoscope. She likes it and it sounds great but as someone else wrote in the review, the earpieces for her are also very large which makes it hard for it to stay in her ears. The product also came open so we wondered if it was a returned product been resold. Still trying to decide if she wants to keep or return it but it definitely sounds great and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Karikari

customer_reviews.title: Clear ausculation
customer_reviews.text: It is an awesome stethoscope, you can hear very well with this kne. I highly recommend it to any nurse or nursing student. The tubing does not kink up soon as you take out of the box you'll be so happy! I suggest getting a personalized name tag.
customer_reviews.author: tequila

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk doesnt work.  Go for the littmann cardio iv.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. Purchased for my wife as she wanted to try a lightweight one...she opened the box and tried it on me...said she couldnt hear correctly....its cheap and doesnt work...so I ordered the regular cardio littman iv for 158$ and it arrived the next day...today and she tried it and it worked perfectly. Dont waste your money buying this cheap one. I emailed amazon letting them know I wanted to return it...its non returnable...but amazon refunded the money...cause as soon as I sent the email I ordered the regular one.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for your money
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it’s light weight and I love the pearl blue color. I’m a little disappointed in the quality. I can’t hear as well as I’d like. I’m a critical care nurse and have been in nursing for 32 yrs. This stethoscope is a good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: angie reardon

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for the buck, light weight and nice head shape for sticking under the cuff for a BP. The light construction might be an issue for audio interference, but for the most part for what I do as an EMT I just need to listen to rate, quality and presence and even in a noisy ambulance it is more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I think this is an okay starter stethoscope. However, I personally have trouble hearing through it. I can get vitals done with it but distinguishing heart sounds and picking up on murmurs-forget it! It's too muffled. The acoustics just aren't clear or loud at all. And on top of that, you can still hear noises from the bell while listening through the diaphragm! It's very distracting and makes it even harder to distinguish any bodily noises.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee@Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Can’t hear vitals
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the Littmann lightweight II stethoscope in the past and I absolutely love it! However, after purchasing a second one, I have found that I have been rechecking blood pressures on a regular basis because I cannot hear them. I’m not sure what the issue is, but I am going to be using my new one as a “backup” and switch back to my stethoscope ive been using the past two years (the same just in another color.) This new one just isn’t cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous stethoscopes for nurses, vet techs, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my vet techs in my veterinary clinic for getting heart rates on patients. They're super lightweight, easy to learn on, and provide good clarity with auscultation. They're not as good as the Littmann Cardio III or Master Cardiology, so I wouldn't necessarily recommend these for doctors that depend on auscultation. For support staff that are running around like crazy and just need to get vitals, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: NicbachDVM

customer_reviews.title: Starter
customer_reviews.text: Littmann is top of the line. This stethoscope is a good starter, especially for a nursing student, but is not career worthy. The bell/diaphragm is too big and clunky and is hard to pinpoint abnormal sounds. It is not usefull for pediatrics at all . It is just simply to big. The extra 20 dollars is worth it for the next model up. I purchased this one as a secondary stethescope after i misplaced my good one. It did the job i needed it to do, but as soon as i found my other one i went back to it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive and compact
customer_reviews.text: I tried this stethoscope out on cardiac patients right after getting it and thought it was immensely clear and sensitive enough to pick up subtle murmurs. It shouldn't be expected to be as good as a cardiology stethoscope but is great if you wear it around your next for 12 hours at a time. A remarkable product for the price. If you have trouble auscultations with this you should get your hearing checked.
customer_reviews.author: robert cole

customer_reviews.title: Love my littman lightweight stethoscopes
customer_reviews.text: Love my littman lightweight stethoscopes! Not super expensive, and definitely not cheaply made! I hear what I need to hear and it doesn’t weigh me down. Very comfortable. I recommend these to nursing students and any nurses in general! Unless you’re in a specialty department and need to hear more
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Could not hear as well with this one
customer_reviews.text: It may be my older ears, though I still have very sensitive hearing, or who knows, it may have been a knock-off, but it looked real to me. I just could not hear as well with it than the Classic 3 Littmann, or even the Prestige Clinical 1, so I went with the latter because it performed so close to the 3 that it seemed a no-brainer to me. I say try it and see how it works for you, as it might be great for you and might be exactly what you want. We're not all the same that way, and even variances in manufacture can make large differences in what we hear.
customer_reviews.author: mr blue

customer_reviews.title: Best Priced Littmann
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stethoscope! The sound is very comparable and almost identical to the littmann classic iii and for the price I would prefer it! The ceil blue color is very pretty and the stethoscope is very light on my neck. I added a stethoscope ID tag off of Etsy and it looks great! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Got for pet rats, seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get one of these to help me listen to my rat's breathing and heart beats. Since they're prone to respiratory infections, it can be really important to hear it early so they can get treated as quickly as possible. I feel better having them around, and I get the feeling that it'll help when they actually get sick too, since it'd let me listen to how their lungs are sounding while they recover. This is probably a near necessity to have if you own pet rats, heck any pet I guess, but especially for rats. The price and quality seem good, at least for what I want it for. The color is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Blood Pressure Readings
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Stethoscope at home for home blood pressure readings for my husband. This one is perfect. As a nurse, I have another more expensive one for work, but this one provides for good lung sounds and use of blood pressure readings. Came super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: I had to strain my ears to pick up any sound coming from the heart and it was extremely faint at best. I called littmann and exp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to monitor my a-fib. I read numerous reviews on this item and thought it would work for me. I had to strain my ears to pick up any sound coming from the heart and it was extremely faint at best. I called littmann and explained my problem to them. They told me that unit was better suited for monitoring pulse when monitoring blood pressure readings. Would not recommend this product for anyone wanting to be able to listen to your heart.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Asymmetrically Disproportionate Stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: So I compared this well known “quality” brand stethoscope to my other stethoscope (MDF) also great quality, and Littmann did not match up. The Littmann is light weight, the price is great, but I can’t look past the ear tubes being disproportionate. This irritates me but thats a personal opinion. If you’re not worried about imperfections or the “appearance“ of your stethoscope then this would be a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yahaira10472

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good product.
customer_reviews.text: For a littmann it’s not the best sound quality there is. My cardiology 2 and classic 2 both blow it out of the water. But for a lightweight, affordable stethoscope it’s amazing! I got it for nursing school and it was perfect! I will say if you have it against your scrubs, the matte finish of the rubber picks up the color of whatever you are wearing from day one. It will never, ever come out. I found the shape of the bell a bit awkward but others may not.
customer_reviews.author: Happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Quite good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Quite good for the price. My husband ordered this and being a former paramedic, he's selective. He says Littmann has always been one of the best and this lower-end model is very sensitive which is great so there you have it!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi T.

customer_reviews.title: The sounds quality is not great, but the style is cute
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered from Amazon this super cheap stethescope and was embarrased to take it with me to work, so I ordered a Littman like everyone said. Well I had a household of people try both and the cheap one for $12 had better sound quality than the Littman and two were nurses! On a positive note, it is super cute and the color is fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: LisaMarie Atchley

customer_reviews.title: WORKS LIKE A CHAMP
customer_reviews.text: I am nursing a beloved and very sick cat and needed a stethoscope to check his heart rate. This one is so sensitive that I can count heartbeats through the noise of his purrs, so it does the trick and I'm happy with it. Being a neophyte, it took me a minute to figure out which way to put the stethoscope in my ears, but that turned out to be a no-brainer because you can't hear anything if the device is backwards. An added bonus is the color selection, so it is an attractive addition to my small, but growing, medical kit. I recommend it to you.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Littmann
customer_reviews.text: My first lightweight Littmann stethoscope & I LOVE it! Good sound quality, light around my neck & a great price. Only downside is no replacement diaphragm or ear tips included. I suppose I shouldn't have expected those due to cost of stethoscope. Hope I'm able to get a few years of use. Overall happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 10n4re

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this to practice taking vitals in an Emergency Medical Technician course. The sound is great and the quality of stethoscope feels nice while being light weight. I have practiced this on young adults and seniors without a difference in sound quality for their heartbeats. But if you’re working with overweight patients, this might not get you the sounds you’re looking for. I plan on using this as I continue on to working as an EMT and upgrading later on down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great quality at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I use the lightweight everyday for work as a paramedic. The sound quality is really good, and the price makes it so I am not as worried about losing it on a scene as I used to be about my Pittman cardiology stethoscope. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Melnotte

customer_reviews.title: The best value for quality
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted a really nice Littman stethoscope when I started medical school. Over time every stethoscope for me has the metal flex portion crack. I replace that nice Littman with the same one but then I took a chance on this cheaper Littman and the sound quality is just as good but now I don’t spend so much to replace after they break
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight stethoscope. The head of the scope fits great under tight BP cuffs and is easy to use. It’s not heavy at all and is comfortable to wear around my neck/shoulders all day. Prefect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Kari Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Super Clear Sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought a sphygmomanometer that included a stethoscope which was cheap and very uncomfortable when placed in the ears, worse thing was that you could barely hear anything. Littmann has a reputation that speaks for itself so I thought I’d give it a try and buy this one, one of their more affordable models. It works fantastic! Much better than I expected! Looks + feels high quality, sounds great and they don’t hurt your ears at all. Basically, if you’re not sure just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Rizik

customer_reviews.title: Much better than other inexpensive brands
customer_reviews.text: We tried a less expensive brand (about $10 less) and could not hear my wife's heartbeat. She has PVC's and we wished to monitor them, especially if she was feeling a little "funny". These work well and we can hear her heartbeat in all four locations very well (no....she only has one heart! If she had four we would not be concerned!! :)) Although the Classic model is probably better (our RN nurse uses that one) we think this one serves us well. By the way, our RN daughter listened with this Lightweight model and was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Slowdog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Match!
customer_reviews.text: I got this stethoscope to replace the previous version of it that I had been using for years that finally bit the dust, this one works just the same and as accurately as previous versions. And luckily the pieces from the older version fit this one as well so I was able to keep the part that weren't ruined in case anything goes amiss with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Seriously LacqueingTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Best littman I’ve ever had!
customer_reviews.text: Best littman I’ve ever owned! I have always bought the more expensive kind with the shiny tubing, but after my last one cracked after less than a year of use I decided to go with this style. I wear it around my neck for12+ hours so I thought that was the problem, but after owning this style I won’t go back. It’s much more light weight, and the sound quality is even better than the more expensive style. You can’t beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Michele D'Amico

customer_reviews.title: Stetho for my hubby!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband, he is going to school to learn how to be an EMT. He uses this in class and on me at home to practice. He is very happy with this product and would recommend it to anyone looking for a stethoscope. He showed me how it works, I do not have another to compare it to, but it did what it promised and it did it well!
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my wife. She loves it, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. She loves it, and has to keep it on her person as the few times she has put it down at work and walked away for a few minutes it gets " borrowed " and she has to search it down. Now it stays in her lab coat pocket or around her neck.
customer_reviews.author: Ruba

customer_reviews.title: I'm baffled at the good reviews for this stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: I'm baffled at the good reviews for this stethoscope. This stethoscope is only good for the best case scenario - easily detectable sounds and a person of healthy weight. I just ordered the Littman cardiology IV; here's hoping that is it much much better!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Eh, I upgraded.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and ended up getting the 3M Littmann Classic II Master, the sound quality is just so much better in that model. This would be ok to keep in a car or at home for emergencies but I would not want to use this daily at work, the audio quality just isn't there.
customer_reviews.author: Foo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I work as a medical assistant and this is a great stethoscope for blood pressures and such. The length is a little shorter than I would like but I love the quality and the feather like weight I barely notice it's there most of the time!
customer_reviews.author: kelsi

customer_reviews.title: Great stethoscope, can hear so well
customer_reviews.text: I've been a home health therapist for 5 years. This has been my favorite stethoscope after trying 4. My last one only lasted about 2 years (just recently got this one which is just like it). I live in the south and leave it in my bag during extreme heat and cold (which I shouldn't be doing), so I'll take better care of this one and expecting it to last longer. I hear crystal clear with this stethoscope! Purple color is as pictured and lovely. Wish it wasn't quite so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Pearce Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Low sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this. It had very poor sound quality. It was my 2nd returned stethoscope for the same issue. I thought it was just me, so I had coworkers try it and they had the same problem. I ended up ordering the Litteman III and am happy with that one. The III is double the cost, but worth it for having dependable equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Te-Te

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stethoscope because I didn't like how heavy my previous stethoscope was. This stethoscope is very lightweight and is a lovely color but the sound quality is fairly poor. I struggle to hear breath sounds on any of my heavier patients, which does make up a large part of the patient population. I have mostly gone back to using my old stethoscope because I don't want to trade my neck comfort for my assessment abilities.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Received this stethoscope yesterday and tested it out right away. The sensitivity of the drum is exactly what I was looking for, and I really like its ergonomic design. The earpieces are comfortable but fit securely in the ears. It was packaged carefully to preserve its quality during shipping. Overall, I am very pleased with both the design and functionality of this stethoscope. I would recommend it to any health professional looking for a durable and reliable instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya B Swyt

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but does it's job well
customer_reviews.text: Somehow, I left this in my old car after an accident 😯. I was never able to get it back. This is my exact replacement. Hold on to your Littmann folks. These stethoscopes notoriously get stollen and go "missing". This little cheap stethoscope has come through when other high end stethoscopes did not. I recommend to any nursing student or anyone working in a general healthcare setting. The sound can become compromised (once it gets old) so try to keep it in a case.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Can not hear with this Littmann.Very disappointed. I called the company and they were supposed to send me a address to return the item for repair but I have not received a response. There’s no reason a brand new LIttmann should need repairing.
customer_reviews.author: veronica oxendine

customer_reviews.title: Good, lightweight stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: I got this when I started a new job and was going to have to wear a stethoscope all day and take manual blood pressures. I wasn’t very experienced in taking blood pressures so I wanted something that would be clear and good quality. That’s what this is. Other people I work with but cheaper stethoscopes and say they get too heavy to keep wearing after a 12 hour shift.. I personally have no problem and honestly, forget it’s there. I’m very happy with this stethoscope for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: I never thought I'd splurge on a littmann
customer_reviews.text: I used a coworkers stethescope and man was I impressed! I have piercings that can be pulled when using the stethoscopes with the plastic buds. These have the flexible comfy ear plugs that don't disturb my piercings at all. After using hers I ordered one for myself in the purple color and I HAVE NOT PUT IT DOWN. I always make sure that I have it before leaving for work every single day. It's so crisp and clear and sturdy. You get your bang for your buck. I use it several times a day 5 days a week with each shift being 8-12 hours long. It's been the best $50 I've spent in a VERY long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like many of the other one star reviews I also ...
customer_reviews.text: Like many of the other one star reviews I also cannot hear anything! I bought this because I thought it would amplify the BP sounds compared to my old stand by CVS stethoscope. Now my old standby sounds wonderful compared to this. I also will attempt to get a return as I thought all PRIME came with a return option. Turns out I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: 2TH4A

customer_reviews.title: Cannot hear anything.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stethoscope for nursing school and used it for the first time today and was not able to hear anything (even my professor said something is wrong with it). Maybe it’s damaged but I’m very disappointed because I couldn’t perform well in the class and this item was pretty pricey compared to the stethoscopes my classmates had.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner stethoscope!
customer_reviews.text: I love this beginner stethoscope! I bought this one for my nurse (LPN) who needed one for work and school (RN). I used one like it for a total of 8 years - while working through RN school, graduate school, and 2 years into practice. I’ve diagnosed many cardiac and lung issues with this little tool. I finally upgraded to a Littman Cards IV. Yes, a big difference; but you have to start somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Miller

customer_reviews.title: so so light, it’s my go to!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a PCT at my local hospital, this thing is so lightweight. My old classic littmann stethoscope felt so heavy on my shoulders. The feedback you get when getting a blood pressure is amazing. -side note- Don’t leave it in your car hanging on your mirror, it tends to make the tubing a bit more stiff (a friend did that with hers)
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value, Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m a medicine resident with a hearing impairment. I previously had the Littmann 3200 so I can increase the sound but it ended up malfunctioning. I ordered this in a pinch and it is actually very good, clear. Easy to identify physical exam abnormalities.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brown

customer_reviews.title: Preferred stethoscope for medical professionals
customer_reviews.text: This is my brand of choice for stethoscopes. I am a nurse for about 10 years now. I first used Littmann when I was in nursing school. I have been using their stethoscopes since. I got a new one for my first work. And it’s my gift of choice for anyone I know going to nursing or medical school.
customer_reviews.author: mq cox

customer_reviews.title: Expected so much more from a littmann......
customer_reviews.text: Well it is definitely lightweight, easy around the neck or in a pocket. But unfortunately that’s the only positive I can say about this scope. I am shocked at how bad the sound quality of this is, I expected so much more out of it, I mean it’s a littmann. If you just want something lightweight to wear on your neck this scope is great, but if you plan on using it clinically don’t waste your time or money on this. If you are looking at this and think wow a littmann for $40 that’s to good to be true, yes it is, do yourself a favor and buy a better scope.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C. Mcqueen

customer_reviews.title: Presentation is important
customer_reviews.text: The box to this stethoscope is crumpled and dented. This is a stethoscope for a brand new nurse and to give it to her in a nasty box isn’t fair. Littman stethoscopes are one of the best brands in the word and I’m very sad I have to give my friend this gift in this box. Come on guys, you can do better than this. Not impressed. If my packages are going to keep coming damaged I’ll just go to the store and get it and pick the one I want.
customer_reviews.author: Kim goss

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the same Littman stethoscope that I've been using for years, and I was happy to see that it was still being sold... good sound quality, and lightweight around my neck. Great price -- ordered and received on THE SAME DAY! -- doesn't get better than that!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: it is very lightweight and much more comfortable to wear around my neck daily. however, trade off is not as good acoustic as my regular littman. however if you are in neuro and barely listen to hearts anyway, this would suffice.
customer_reviews.author: Minh

customer_reviews.title: Its just Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Yes it might feel lightweight but so does a feather boa on your shoulders. I could probably hear as much with the boa as I do with this stethoscope. Just a waste of money. Littmann is usually so reliable too, disappointing that they would create such a product.
customer_reviews.author: Anchorage

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent stethoscope at a good price point. Noticeably lower sound quality than a littman classic but it gets the job done. Wouldn’t recommend for anyone new to the healthcare field, as the sound quality isn’t as good as it could be
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for blood pressures. It works good for that. It just 'feels' cheap. The bell does not really have the quality feel I was looking for. Even though it is on the cheaper end for a Littmann, I still expected a sturdy feel too it. It works for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Blood Pressure?
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because they were lightweight for nursing school. Really hard to hear as all I could hear was static when taking a bp
customer_reviews.author: Laura de Sosa

customer_reviews.title: Bell doesn't pick up heart sounds
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this stethescope. It picks up the lung sounds using the diaphram side, but with the bell side (used to pick up lower frequencies) I wasn't able to hear the heart. I had to use the diaphram side (which picks up higher frequencies) but it still was very faint.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good Bang For Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: I am highly satisfied with my purchase. Originally, I was hesitant to purchase it because my old stethoscope was lightweight, and it was difficult to hear heart sounds. Thankfully, my co-worker has this stethoscope, and I decided to make the purchase. This is the 3rd stethoscope that I have owned and is by far the best quality. I take multiple blood pressures as day and have yet to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the one star reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar experience as others regarding the terrible sound quality of this stethoscope. I’m not confident that the manufacturer is supplying Amazon with the same quality they are shipping to other retailers and will find one at a reliable medical supply store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Good stethoscope for the price. Tube is noticably thinner than more expensive models. Only downside is that the operator needs to be aware of the pressure they are putting on the bell as the membrane is variable. This is stated in the instructions as how you hear high and low tones. Just takes some critical thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a quality piece!
customer_reviews.text: I am a respiratory therapist and I do not bring my stethoscope home from work to reduce the risk of bringing home all manner of germs. Since I have a dog with heart and lung issues, I needed a home-use stethoscope so that I could monitor him. This one fits the bill!
customer_reviews.author: M. Doty

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I am just an EMT and Firefighter, but this stethoscope if VASTLY superior to anything the department issues us or is in any of our med bags!! You can actually hear the heart/lung sounds CLEARLY and NOT have to double guess what your hearing!! Great job yall!!
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work for me...
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend this. Can barely hear heartbeat as long as there is no other noise in the room. I found out it can't be returned either. Maybe its my hearing and I will continue to try to use it since I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Shepard

customer_reviews.title: SUPERB SETHOSCOPE HIGHTLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: This stethoscope is light weight and easy to carry around, its one of Littmann most reasonable priced stethoscope, it's popular with nurses and doctors in the hospital where I work, highly recommended for students, its very comfortable to use , the sound is distinct, its the best I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: TERENCE

customer_reviews.title: Sounds a lot better than the off brand
customer_reviews.text: Sounds a lot better than the off brand. My cousin gave me off brand and you can tell that Littmann is better. This stethoscope is very lightweight and you can hear way better. Not too bad for the price either. Very well worth the price. Highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Low Sound level
customer_reviews.text: The sound level is really low for this Stethoscope. The room must be very quiet in order to hear the Stethoscope. If there are any noise distractions then forget about hearing anything. I thought 3M was a high quality company.
customer_reviews.author: Chris swan

customer_reviews.title: Useless /  Impossible to hear heart valves or breathing.  /  Other Reviewers Say it is Counterfit
customer_reviews.text: 1) Impossible to hear heart valves or breathing, at all with this stethoscope. 2) Only useful for blood pressure testing 3) Reported by other reviewers as a cheap knock off counterfit 4) It simply doesn’t work Returned / Useless
customer_reviews.author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent brand and quality
customer_reviews.text: Most common brand used in the medical field and has been proven for its excellence time after time. If this is your first time using these in the field or area with a lot of noise in the background you may have a little trouble listening until you get used to it. Other than that they are a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua H.

customer_reviews.title: Almost like a toy
customer_reviews.text: I should have believed the bad reviews. As a new medical assistant, I normally just use a stethoscope for blood pressures. I’ve been using the office stethoscope, which is a Littmann Classic III, and decided to purchase my own. I used it on my husband and my golden retriever, and the sound quality was terrible. I almost seems like a toy stethoscope. So disappointing. I am exchanging it for the Littmann Classic III.
customer_reviews.author: KitKat

customer_reviews.title: Great for heart sounds, not so great for lung sounds and manual blood pressure
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for nursing school. Didn't work very well for manual blood pressure practice because the stethoscope didn't pick up brachial artery sounds. Tried it for physical assessment practice and could hear nothing except the heart beat over the pulmonary and aortic landmarks. Will return and purchase the Littmann III stethoscope instead because that worked very well for my classmates.
customer_reviews.author: Tashagay Williams

customer_reviews.title: After looking through the best bargain stethoscopes Amazon has to offer
customer_reviews.text: After looking through the best bargain stethoscopes Amazon has to offer, I decided to purchase the Littman Lightweight. I bought it specifically to use for Nursing school. It is very simple and professional looking, and very lightweight! For the most part, the sounds are very clear and distinct. I have only come across one issue, being the end of the tube directly connected to the diaphragm. If twisted (which is very tempting if you are bored), it can partially disconnect from the tube and create a deafened sound. Twisting it again is a quick fix. Overall, quality product!
customer_reviews.author: tessmi7

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a Littman!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing price for a Littman. Super lightweight with good sound quality. My previous Littman was well over $100 and I don't see much difference in this one. My previous stethoscope was broken during one of my shifts and I was in a real bind. I couldn't order a new one quickly enough (during Covid period) and we didn't have any disposable ones in the meantime. It took some extra time to be delivered but I wasn't disappointed. I use my stethoscope frequently (ICU RN) and I'm really happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective and ineligible for return
customer_reviews.text: The bell on the stethoscope is defective. It does not work. I am in nursing school and used the stethoscope on my first day of on site clinical. I could hear nothing from the bell at all. But I could hear sounds on the cheap free stethoscopes they gave us. I tried to return the item and the response was item ineligible for return. I am stuck with a $50 defective stethoscope. Buyers beware when purchasing this product. They do not let you return it if it is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Mckay

customer_reviews.title: A replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement because someone stole my original one. That should tell you it’s good. Keep it under lock and key and loan to no one. Fortunately it’s a very affordable model, so if someone does end up taking it off your hands unexpectedly, you should be able to get another for not much.
customer_reviews.author: D. Giff

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality is BAD!
customer_reviews.text: Been using stethoscopes for years. This has to be the worst one I've ever used. I cannot even hear my own heartbeat with it. If you thump on it hard with your finger you can hear that but for blood pressure readings, forget it. I've had $5 sets that worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Poison Sumac

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound quality of these. As a surgical nurse, I work in a very loud environment with machines constantly beeping. These are the only stethoscopes I can use and actually hear my patient. Only 4 stars because this color was a bit off. I liked the lavender better.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I worked over the summer as a nurse's assistant at a camp so I wanted a better stethoscope than the super cheap one's they had but I didn't want to spend a ton of money. This stethoscope was PERFECT! It's super lightweight and the difference between this and the super cheap ones is amazing. I wen't through EMT class and run at a rescue squad and have used it several times on calls in the back of a noisy ambulance and it is holding up well. I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: again the star rating should be good enough for most products forcing a written review before it will except a review is nonsense unless you want to write something if it continues I will just stop reviewing products all together..
customer_reviews.author: Rachel life

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t hear a thing with this. Bought a cheaper version it worked better than this. Threw this one away
customer_reviews.author: Jane Smith

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because my father uses this company at work. We use it when going on trips to monitor his blood pressure and it works amazingly. It was my first time taking blood pressures and after a couple of tries i was able to get the pressure right every time.
customer_reviews.author: ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my first stethoscope for EMT school and will probably use this during nursing school as well. Practiced on my family and even my dogs and was able to hear lung sounds as well as pulse.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great quality over the cheap hospital ones
customer_reviews.text: My infant was diagnosed with SVT and we needed something to check his heart rate regularly. The hospital gave us a cheap stethoscope but our cardiologist suggested getting one of the brands. We do notice the difference between the two. We’re very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin N

customer_reviews.title: Really great for a starter!
customer_reviews.text: I just started my job as a Nurse Tech on a cardiac step down unit and we have had to do some manual BPs and this is so perfect for that! I can’t hear anything out of the stethoscopes the hospital has for us to use, so I decided to invest in my own. Best decision!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Compares Well Against More Expensive Equipment
customer_reviews.text: The Littmann Lightweight II S.E. Stethoscope by 3M was recommended by our medical professionals. Not exactly a toy, you'd think (and rightly!) -- yet our 4 young boys love it, too. They check out their own and each other's heartbeats, as well as enjoy all the stomach noises! The adults use it mostly for the ordinary lung and blood pressure checks that make it a standard household item. Importantly, this particular Littmann 'scope compares well against far more expensive equipment and is thus the one I most highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mom

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS! THIS IS JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read the reviews, then I bought this. I don’t know how this junk got almost 5 star review!! I bought one but I couldn’t hear anything, then I thought maybe this one is defective, then I order another one but the second one was the same. So I realized this is nothing but peace of junk.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my kid because she gets sick often and she has chronic diseases. This will help me listen to her lungs so I know when I need to take her to her PCP. I am very happy with my purchase, the stethoscope can get very pricy but I got lucky because I bought it on lighting deal. Strongly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: WC

customer_reviews.title: Great for EMS
customer_reviews.text: Great for EMS, will do everything you need and you wont cry for 3 days if someone walks off with it. This does great for breath sounds and blood pressures which if you're honest with yourself as an EMT or Paramedic is about all you're going to use it for with the exception of confirming ET tube placement or something like that which this also works good for.
customer_reviews.author: Grant H.

product_meta.title: 3M Littmann Lightweight II S.E. Stethoscope, Black Tube, 28 Inch, 2450
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe 3M Littmann Lightweight II S.E. Stethoscope is an ideal entry-level instrument, with a tunable diaphragm, dual-sided chestpiece, and reliable acoustic performance. Its teardrop shape makes auscultation around blood pressure cuffs easier. The suggested use for the Littmann Lightweight II S.E. Stethoscope is as a diagnostic aid as part of the physical assessment of a patient. It is Ideally suited for certified nursing assistants, licensed practical nurses, EMT/EMS, licensed vocational nurses, medical assistants and nursing students. The power to learn in the palm of your hand with our free educational app. Practice your auscultation skills anytime, anywhere with the 3M Littmann Learning Institute app, free with the purchase of a 3M Littmann Stethoscope. The app allows you to practice and improve your auscultations skills, which can result in better performance in school or your practice and provide better patient outcomes. With the app, you can: Develop diagnostic skills using patient scenarios Listen to real heart and lung sounds to recognize different conditions Track your progress Test your knowledge Unlock the full content of the app with the serial number found on the chestpiece of your Littmann stethoscope. Go to the iTunes App Store or Google Play to download the free app and start training today! The colors shown online are approximations. We have made every effort to show the best possible match to the color of the actual product. However, some variation is expected, due to differences in both lighting and monitor calibration.
feature_bullets: Provides reliable acoustic performance for taking blood pressure readings and making limited physical assessments of adult patients
Tunable diaphragm responds with a simple pressure change to capture low and high frequency sounds
Tear drop shape for easy fit under blood pressure cuff
Anatomically designed headset is angled to meet the path of the ear canal
Nonchill rim and diaphragm provide welcome patient comfort

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
